alert.note: Alert for Brown; Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued August 10 at 4:31PM MDT until August 10 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: The National Weather Service in Aberdeen has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Brown County in northeastern South Dakota... North central Spink County in northeastern South Dakota... * Until 600 PM CDT. * At 530 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Hutterville Colony, or 15 miles southeast of Warner, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Brown and north central Spink Counties. in the 70s to lower 80s in the upper trough. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
